is required to use this soundtrack!

is required to use this soundtrack!

text.lobby.info.combat.title.name: Combat
text.lobby.info.intro.title.name: Introduction
text.lobby.info.lobby.title.name: The Lobby
text.lobby.info.river.title.name: The River
text.lobby.info.shop.title.name: Item Shop
text.lobby.info.command.title.name: Commands
text.lobby.info.combat.page1: Players have access to two weapons at the start of each match: the Hookshot and the Hatchet. The Hookshot is a modified crossbow; its arrows will latch into any target hit and pull them back. The Hatchet is a simple axe that just deals damage on melee attack. The Hatchet can damage all players, while the Hookshot only does damage to enemies (but can pull both enemies and allies).
text.lobby.info.combat.page2: An important mechanic surrounding the Hookshot is headshots. A headshot occurs when a player who is already getting pulled by a hook gets hit with another player's hook. A headshot instantly kills the player, regardless of current health. It is important to note that players can kill their own teammates in this way, but that is not necessarily a bad thing! Headshotting a teammate results in a deny, and prevents the enemy team from otherwise receiving gold or kill credit.
text.lobby.info.combat.page3: Killing a teammate in any way other than a headshot will result in a gold penalty applied to the attacker. The specific amount can be configured in the lobby, but defaults to 10 gold.
text.lobby.info.intro.page1: Welcome to Hook, Line, and Creeper! This map was created by Strongis13 and Soccby as a Minecraft recreation of the popular Warcraft 3 custom map "Pudge Wars" by Tossrock and Siraraz. Continue reading for more information about this map and it's mechanics!
text.lobby.info.intro.page2: This map is a modified team deathmatch gamemode, where both teams are trying to obtain as many kills as possible. The game ends when one of two victory conditions are met: either the time limit expires or one team reaches the target number of kills. Only one of these conditions is active at a time, and is chosen before the game begins.
text.lobby.info.intro.page3: The current score of both teams is displayed at the top of the screen. The current victory condition is also shown in this location. Check out the other sections on the information board for more detailed information on other aspects of the map!
text.lobby.info.lobby.page1: The Lobby serves as the waiting room between matches. From here, players are able to join a team or configure various settings that will be used in the next match.
text.lobby.info.lobby.page2.2: Villagers are located on opposite sides of the Lobby that correspond to either team. Another villager sits next to the campfire to select a Random team. Interact with a villager to join that team. Interacting again with the same villager will cause you to leave the team. If a game starts while you are not on a team you will be placed in spectator mode.
text.lobby.info.lobby.page3.2: The sign board opposite of the Information board contains multiple pages of settings that control aspects of the game. Examples are the number of kills required to win, the amount of gold items from the shop cost, and what custom background music to use. The settings can be changed by right-clicking on the signs. Any sign that uses a number value as an option can accept a custom input by sneak+right-clicking on the sign and following the prompt in chat.
text.lobby.info.lobby.page4.2: After all players have picked their team and all settings have been set, a game can be started by clicking on the Start Game sign. There must be at least 1 player on any team before a game can be started.
text.lobby.info.command.page1.2: Vote to skip the current song. At least 50% of players need to agree for a song to be skipped.
text.lobby.info.command.page1.4: Vote for your team to surrender the game, causing the other team to immediately win. All players except 1 on a team need to agree to surrender.
text.lobby.info.command.page1.6: While not technically a chat command, players can adjust the volume of custom music or sound effects from the "Options > Music & Sounds..." page. We recommend lowering the Custom Music volume to 10-20% for new players!
text.lobby.info.river.page1: The River is an important terrain feature in Hook, Line, and Creeper. It is the dividing line between the Red and Blue bases, serving as an impassable barrier. Players who find themselves in the river may find it difficult to escape on their own without the help of an item or another player. At the center of the river is a Healing Totem, which significantly increases the speed of health regeneration for all nearby players within the particle circle.
text.lobby.info.river.page2.1: Special Power-ups will periodically spawn in the river, starting on a random side and flowing to the opposite side. Any player can collect these power-ups by shooting them with their Hookshot. Upon collecting a power-up, its effect will immediately begin. Click one of the links below for more information about a specific power-up:
text.lobby.info.river.page3.2: Gain an Elyra and unlimited firework rockets for 20 seconds. There is no damage from falling or flying too fast into walls, so go crazy!
text.lobby.info.river.page5.2: All players currently dead are immediately respawned, and a Deathmatch starts. During a deathmatch, a red screen tint appears and the normal background music is interrupted. All players slowly lose health over time, the speed of which will increase the longer the deathmatch goes on.
text.lobby.info.river.page6.2: Players cannot respawn during a deathmatch; they instead spectate the remaining players until the deathmatch ends. Once one entire team has been defeated, the deathmatch concludes and the remaining alive players evenly split a 100 gold bounty. The game then resumes as normal.
text.lobby.info.river.page7.2: All enemy players are immediately hooked and will begin getting pulled towards you, as if you just hit each of them with your Hookshot.
text.lobby.info.river.page8.2: After a short delay, begin firing a barrage of arrows in the direction you are facing. These arrows are treated as if they were fired from your Hookshot.
text.lobby.info.river.page9.2: After a 10 second delay, you blow up and instantly kill all players within 6 blocks of your location (including yourself).
text.lobby.info.river.page10.2: For the next 15 seconds, all of your cooldowns will recharge at 3x speed.
text.lobby.info.shop.page1: The Item Shop is where players are able to spend their gold on various different upgrades. Players are able to obtain gold from two primary sources: passive income or kill rewards. Both sources of gold are configurable from the lobby.
text.lobby.info.shop.page2: Passive income is very slow by default at 1 gold every 4 seconds. The default kill reward is 20 gold per kill. This amount can increase or decrease during a single match, and can be different from player to player. A player will award more gold if they currently have a high killstreak, and will reward less gold if they have died multiple times in a row without getting a kill.
text.lobby.info.shop.page3: The shops are the ender chests located at opposite ends of the map. The items in the shop are divided into three tabs: Stats, Abilities, and Consumables. Consumable items can be bought an unlimited number of times, while Stat and Ability items can be bought 5 times each, providing a stacking effect each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page4.1: Click on any of the items below to jump to that page.
text.lobby.info.shop.page5.2: Buying this upgrade reduces the cooldown of your Hookshot by 0.4 seconds each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page6.2: Buying this upgrade increases the damage of your Hookshot by 0.5 hearts each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page7.2: Buying this upgrade increases the number of times the arrows fired from your Hookshot will bounce off of walls and floors by 1 each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page8.2: Buying this upgrade increases the damage of your Hatchet by 0.3 hearts each purchase. This map keeps track of the player's health in increments of 0.1 hearts, even though it only displays in half hearts.
text.lobby.info.shop.page9.2: Buying this upgrade increases your maximum health by 2 hearts each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page10.2: Buying this ability gives you a throwable creeper egg which will explode on impact, damaging and knocking back all players in range. Damage and Knockback strength increase with each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page11.2: Buying this ability gives you a passive random chance when hit with an enemy Hookshot to dodge the hook instead, and place this ability on a 30 second cooldown. The success chance increases with each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page12.2: Buying this ability gives you a special stick, which deals no damage but has a high knockback value. The knockback strength increases with each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page13.2: Buying this ability gives you another hook, but you are pulled to wherever the hook lands (instead of pulling a target to you). The Grappling Hook can land on the ground or hit another player, and you will be pulled to its location regardless. The cooldown decreases with each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page14.2: Buying this ability gives you a passive lifestealing effect, causing you to instantly restore health on every successful shot from your Hookshot and quickly regenerate health from every kill you acquire by any method. Lifestealing can only apply when interacting with enemy players. The health restored increases with each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page14.3: 0.5 hearts on hit, 1 heart on kill
text.lobby.info.shop.page14.4: 1.5 hearts on hit, 3 hearts on kill
text.lobby.info.shop.page15.2: Buying this ability gives you a spammable goat horn, which has no gameplay effect other than being annoying. You can change the sound the horn makes by pressing "
text.lobby.info.shop.page15.3: ". Buying this item more than once does nothing.
text.lobby.info.shop.page16.2: Buying this ability passively increases the speed that your Hookshot and Grappling Hook pull their respective targets. You can hold "
text.lobby.info.shop.page16.3: " during the pull to temporarily disable the increased speed. The pull speed increases with each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page17.2: Buying this ability causes you to gain incredible muscle strength, allowing you to pick up other players. While holding a player, you can throw them by shooting your Hookshot. The player will ride the arrow wherever it goes. The cooldown decreases with each purchase.
text.lobby.info.shop.page18.2: Buying this item instantly heals 2 hearts. The heal is applied instantly after purchasing and cannot be saved for later.
text.lobby.info.shop.page19.2: Buying this item instantly applies a Speed III and Dolphin's Grace I effect for 20 seconds. The effects are applied instantly after purchasing and cannot be saved for later.
text.lobby.info.shop.page20.2: Buying this item instantly increases the damage of your Hookshot by 50% for 20 seconds, but you lose your Hatchet for the same amount of time. The effect is applied instantly after purchasing and cannot be saved for later.
